alert.note: Alert for Menominee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 14 at 4:25PM CDT until March 14 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT BAND OF SNOW EXPECTED OVER CENTRAL AND FAR NORTHEAST WISCONSIN THROUGH EARLY THIS EVENING... .A band of snow will impact parts of central and far northeast Wisconsin through early this evening. The snow may be heavy at times within a narrow band, with snowfall rates of an inch per hour. Areas from southern Marathon to northern Door County will be impacted the most. Snow covered roads and poor visibility will result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow, heavy at times over southern Menominee County. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...Menominee County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow covered roads and poor visibilities. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Wisconsin can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
